tips.title: How to write a great prompt
tips.subtitle: Tips for getting the perfect playlist
tips.intro: Be specific and combine elements for better results. The AI understands context, language, era, and activity.

proTip.title: üí° Pro tip
proTip.description: Combine multiple elements: activity + genre + language + era + artists. Example: 'reggaeton for running, 160 BPM, Spanish only, like Bad Bunny but without Bad Bunny'

includeArtists.title: üéµ Include reference artists
includeArtists.description: Mention 1-2 artists you like so the AI better understands your musical style.
includeArtists.example: reggaeton like Bad Bunny and J Balvin

specifyLanguage.title: üåç Specify the language
specifyLanguage.description: If you want music in a specific language, mention it clearly. Also works with 'Spanish only' or 'English only'.

runningBPM.title: üèÉ For running: specify BPM
runningBPM.description: Specify the tempo you need for your workout. 120-140 BPM for walking, 150-180 BPM for running.

studyInstrumental.title: üìö For studying: ask for instrumental
studyInstrumental.description: If you need concentration, ask for music without vocals. You can also ask for 'lofi' or 'ambient'.
studyInstrumental.example: music for studying, instrumental, no vocals

festivalFormat.title: üé™ Festivals: name + year
festivalFormat.description: For festivals, include the exact name and year. The AI will search for official playlists from that festival.

excludeArtists.title: ‚ùå Exclude specific artists
excludeArtists.description: Use 'without' to exclude artists you don't want. Also works with 'except' or 'no'.
excludeArtists.example: reggaeton like Bad Bunny but without Bad Bunny

specificEra.title: ‚è∞ Specify eras
specificEra.description: Mention specific decades or years for music from that era. '80s', '90s', '2000s', '2010s', '2020s'.

activityContext.title: üéØ Activity context
activityContext.description: Mention what you'll use the playlist for. The AI will adjust tempo and energy according to the activity.
activityContext.example: music for studying, for running, for a party, for cooking

genreCombinations.title: üé® Combine genres
genreCombinations.description: You can mix genres for unique results. You can also ask for 'indie' or 'alternative'.

moodDescriptors.title: üòä Describe the mood
moodDescriptors.description: Use words that describe the mood you're looking for. 'melancholic', 'epic', 'relaxed', 'energetic', 'nostalgic'.

festivalYear.title: üé™ Festivals: include the word 'festival'
festivalYear.description: For specific festivals, include the word 'festival' + name + year. The AI automatically detects any festival worldwide and searches for their official playlists.
festivalYear.example: festival Coachella 2024, festival S√≥nar 2025, festival Tomorrowland 2024, music for festival Primavera Sound 2024
